image.altText: Sam Landsberger

props.synopsis: Tributes are pouring in for the 35-year-old Herald Sun and Fox Footy journalist, who has died after being struck by a truck in Richmond on Tuesday morning.

title.children: Football journalist Sam Landsberger killed in collision at Melbourne intersection

image.altText: Jane Miller smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Ambulance Victoria chief executive officer Jane Miller has resigned from the service weeks after its workers called for a change in leadership.

title.children: Ambulance Victoria CEO resigns after 'no confidence' vote

props.synopsis: The Australian Securities and Investment Commission has released a report on how 15 of the country’s banks are responding to an unprecedented increase in scams.

title.children: New report finds bank scam victims bear the burden 96 per cent of the time

image.altText: Three people standing in a group outside a building saying 'guildford general store'.

props.synopsis: An 89-year-old matriarch and her family will run the town's general store after it went to auction. The community has rallied to save several local institutions in recent years.

title.children: How this small Victorian town saved its general store, pub and school from closure

image.altText: A composite of Eric Andre and Melbourne Airport

props.synopsis: The US comedian posted to social media claiming he was singled out by authorities at the airport due to racial discrimination.

title.children: Comedian Eric André alleges he was racially profiled at Melbourne Airport

image.altText: a man in a pale blue suit outside court

props.synopsis: The 54-year-old is accused of assault, strangulation and burglary relating to several incidents in the Noosa region between December 2023 and early this year.

title.children: Former Test cricketer Michael Slater denied bail on domestic violence charges

image.altText: Biden wipes away tears on stage.

props.synopsis: The Democratic National Convention kicks off in Chicago, with Hillary Clinton speaking ahead of Joe Biden's keynote address to thousands of delegates celebrating presidential nominee Kamala Harris. Follow live.

title.children: Biden says US at a 'rare moment in history' as he speaks to thousands of Democratic party faithful

props.synopsis: In Australia, there are more than twice as many children as childcare places, according to a world-first study analysing childcare access down to the street level in nine developed countries.

title.children: Australia’s childcare divide is growing. Here are the suburbs getting left behind

image.altText: A woman puts her hand over her heart while smiling

props.synopsis: On a night that was meant to be a celebration of his bid for a second term, Joe Biden was moved to tears as he endorsed Kamala Harris. Here's what you missed from day one of the Democratic Convention.

title.children: On day one of the Democratic Convention, Kamala breaks with tradition to address the elephant in the room

image.altText: A man an woman share in a selfie in front of a bridge

props.synopsis: Ross Johnston looked after Christine like she was his granddaughter. When he came to collect her possessions from her country Victorian home he was floored by some of the stories her friends told him about their workplaces.

title.children: Christine worked in Australia to provide her Fijian family a better life. Her death sparked an international investigation

image.altText: Shane Patton looks at the camera with an intense expression.

props.synopsis: Victoria's top cop said more young people are going from "zero to 100" when it comes to offending, in a cultural shift he thinks could be linked in part to the COVID-19 pandemic.

title.children: Youth crime is on the rise, and Victoria's top cop thinks COVID-19 lockdowns have something to do with it

image.altText: A tight head and shoulders shot of Senator Linda Reynolds looking at the camera outside court.

props.synopsis: A clumsily crafted bot network posting about the Linda Reynolds and Brittany Higgins defamation trial likely originated from foreign influencers wielding culturally divisive topics to sow discord, an ABC NEWS Verify analysis finds.

title.children: Seven red flags we identified about the X accounts posting about Reynolds's defamation trial

image.altText: A building on fire with firefighters attending.

props.synopsis: More than 60 firefighters were called to the fire on Hazelwood Road at 12:30am and found flames had already engulfed the roof, causing it to collapse, with crews subsequently only able to save 10 per cent of the main building.

title.children: With not enough water pressure to fight it the much-loved Morwell Bowling Club is destroyed by fire

image.altText: Christian Petracca of the Demons is seen with fans who are hi-fiving from the stands

props.synopsis: Melbourne coach Simon Goodwin says the club has the time to allow disgruntled superstar Christian Petracca to feel happy again following a traumatic period in his career.

title.children: Christian Petracca addresses 'trauma' in meeting with Melbourne teammates as coach swats down trade rumours

image.altText: A composite image of two soldiers, soldiers firing a have weapon, and a brain scan

props.synopsis: Doctors suspect mysterious brain injuries in soldiers repeatedly exposed to blasts and explosions could be the cause of memory loss, headaches, fits of rage and an increased suicide risk.

title.children: How firing their own weapons has put Australia's soldiers at risk of brain injury

image.altText: A bald man wearing glasses and a suit gestures passionately.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers has mocked Opposition Leader Peter Dutton following the Coalition hounding the government again during Question Time.

title.children: Chalmers jabs at Dutton's 'glass jaw' as government ducks more Gaza visa questions — as it happened

image.altText: Australian cyclist Matthew Richardson cheering in delight on his bike after winning a race

props.synopsis: Commonwealth Games gold medallist and Olympian Katherine Bates says cyclist Matthew Richardson's defection to Great Britain is "a break-up you never saw coming".

title.children: Australian athletes feeling 'ripped off' after cyclist's defection to Team Great Britain

image.altText: Birds fly out the front of Parliament House

props.synopsis: The federal government has offered political staffers the maximum pay rise allowed under government rules, along with new travel allowances, leave for cultural activities and extra pay for staff who speak multiple languages.

title.children: Parliamentary staff poised for pay rise with new cultural leave and travel allowances

image.altText: Michael Lynch smiling and wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Mike Lynch is among six people missing after a superyacht carrying 22 people capsized and sank off the coast of Sicily due to bad weather.

title.children: 'British Bill Gates' Mike Lynch among those missing after superyacht sinks in storm off Sicily

image.altText: First responders arrive at the scene of a Greyhound bus collision on Bruce Highway.

props.synopsis: A 52-year-old bus driver from Townsville is charged with five counts of dangerous driving causing death or grievous bodily harm over a crash that killed three people in June.

title.children: Bus driver charged over triple-fatal Bruce Highway crash

image.altText: Sofia

props.synopsis: From country to country, keen sky gazers have diligently captured the first supermoon of the year.

title.children: Rare 'blue' sturgeon supermoon lights up global landmarks

image.altText: Untitled design (4)

props.synopsis: Sovereign citizens are using tax time to spread misinformation about the Australian Taxation Office, including the claim "tax is voluntary" and the authority is "not a legal entity".

title.children: Sovereign citizens warned off using 'hopelessly flawed' logic during tax time

image.altText: wide shot of run down building in Geraldton

props.synopsis: David Ambrosius, 48, reoffended just hours after being released from prison. He had requested his time behind bars be extended at sentencing on Monday, citing his inability to access proper support in the community.

title.children: Homeless man reoffends after asking for two years in jail amid housing crisis

image.altText: A stylised image of a mother cradling a baby.

props.synopsis: Leaked documents obtained by ABC News show child protection workers regularly breached government policy when removing newborns at one of Adelaide's public maternity hospitals.

title.children: Midwives ordered to stop mothers breastfeeding before 'unethical' newborn removals, documents reveal

image.altText: Man working from home in a creative field on his ipad

props.synopsis: New laws come into effect next week that give workers the right to ignore work communications after hours, but they may not be enough to shift Australians' habit of working long hours.

title.children: Australians will soon have the right to switch off after hours — but it might not shift our 'excessive' work culture

image.altText: A reflection of people walking past the ASX indicator board.

props.synopsis: Two weeks ago, fear that global finance was on the eve of destruction caused a wave of panic as traders from New York to Tokyo battled one another in a race to exit financial markets. Now it's but a distant memory.

title.children: What did we learn from this month's stock market crash? Nothing

image.altText: Journalist Masha Gessen standing in front of a blue background.

props.synopsis: Russian-American journalist Masha Gessen has had their visa to enter Australia granted after an earlier delay. They were convicted in Russia of trumped-up charges of spreading false information.

title.children: Journalist and Putin critic Masha Gessen free to enter Australia after visa delay

image.altText: The Assembly. Guest Sam Neill. Ep 1. Image courtesy of ABC.6559

props.synopsis: The legendary actor says he's "very grateful" to be receiving ongoing chemotherapy for blood cancer, but admitted it isn't easy.

title.children: Actor Sam Neill shares the iconic Aussie film role he turned down

image.altText: Donald Trump wears a blue suit and red tie

props.synopsis: The joint statement from the FBI and other federal agencies was the first formal attribution of the hack to a foreign entity.

title.children: Iran to blame for Donald Trump campaign hack, US intelligence officials say

image.altText: A large truck drives past a sign that reads 'Welcome to Hughenden'

props.synopsis: The family, including three children under 12, have been taken to hospital as a precaution after jumping from the moving caravan.

title.children: Five people jump from moving caravan after it was stolen in north Queensland

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Minutes from the recent Reserve Bank board meeting show it was a close call to either lift rates or hold rates steady this month, but the RBA chose to keep its powder dry. Catch up on the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News markets blog.

title.children: RBA minutes reveal rates decision was a close call, ASX closes higher again — as it happened

image.altText: Dan Houston lays a bump on Izak Rankine

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide star Dan Houston's season will be on the line when he fronts the AFL Tribunal over a brutal bump which left Adelaide's Izak Rankine concussed. Ahead of it, he has reached out to his rival to apologise.

title.children: 'In no way a dirty player': Teammate reveals Dan Houston's apology to Izak Rankine ahead of crucial Tribunal date

image.altText: a woman putting a voting ballot paper in a box

props.synopsis: Residents in a slew of New South Wales council areas will not get to vote in the upcoming September local government elections as not enough people have put their hands up to run.

title.children: 'What's the point?': Elections in 14 NSW council areas called off due to lack of candidates
